p: The aims of the present study were to evaluate the PWD risk in 21 Pinus species on a global scale and determine current and future changes in vulnerable regions with climate change. The MB index [ 25], which represents the sum of the difference between the mean monthly temperature and 15 when the mean monthly temperature exceeds 15Â°C, was used to determine vulnerable regions under current and future climate conditions. We also evaluated the impact of climate change on habitat suitability for each of the 21 Pinus species then integrated all the findings in order to discuss the potential risk of PWD spread under future climate change.
